titleStmt.title: Reference list of locations in Ottoman Syria

availability.p: The file was created in November 2012. Latest Update to the data on 10 October 2013

place.desc: This is the actual minarett, belonging to the later Mosque al-Ḥubūbī

projectDesc.p: The TEI file was produced by Till Grallert to provide a list of geo-tagged place names extracted from the chronology and enriched with geo information from geonames.org

editorialDecl.p: For transscribing the Arabic titles of periodicals and the names of the publishers etc., the IJMES paradigm was used.
the structur of the element geo is lat, long

The pattern of xml:ids is the following: - no xml:id: no reference to this place could be found in online databases - xml:id starting with lgn [location geonames] refer to geoname.org/xml:id - xml:id starting with lwm [location wikimapia] refer to wikimapia.org/xml:id - in case of Ottoman provinces named after their capital cities, a "p" is amended to the end of the xml:id.

revisionDesc.change: created a hierarchy of quarters and neighbourhoods in Damascus
